p.b: This code system defines the following properties for its concepts

tr.td: The child code is a more narrow version of the concept represented by the parent code. I.e. Every child concept is also a valid parent concept. Used to allow determination of subsumption. Must be transitive, irreflexive, antisymmetric.
Inverse of Specializes. Only included as a derived relationship.
The internal identifier for the concept in the HL7 Access database repository.
Indicates that the code is abstract - only intended to be used as a selector for other concepts
Designation of a concept's state. Normally is not populated unless the state is retired.

div.p: This case-sensitive code system http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/v3-QueryRequestLimit defines the following codes in a Is-A heirarchy:

tr.td: **Definition:** The number of matching instances (number of focal classes). The document header class is the focal class of a document, a record would therefore be equal to a document.
**Definition:** The number of matching instances (number of focal classes). The document header class is the focal class of a document, a record would therefore be equal to a document.

description.value: **Definition:** Defines the units associated with the magnitude of the maximum size limit of a query response that can be accepted by the requesting application.

copyright.value: This material derives from the HL7 Terminology THO. THO is copyright ©1989+ Health Level Seven International and is made available under the CC0 designation. For more licensing information see: https://terminology.hl7.org/license

description.value: The child code is a more narrow version of the concept represented by the parent code. I.e. Every child concept is also a valid parent concept. Used to allow determination of subsumption. Must be transitive, irreflexive, antisymmetric.
Inverse of Specializes. Only included as a derived relationship.
The internal identifier for the concept in the HL7 Access database repository.
Indicates that the code is abstract - only intended to be used as a selector for other concepts
Designation of a concept's state. Normally is not populated unless the state is retired.

definition.value: **Definition:** The number of matching instances (number of focal classes). The document header class is the focal class of a document, a record would therefore be equal to a document.
**Definition:** The number of matching instances (number of focal classes). The document header class is the focal class of a document, a record would therefore be equal to a document.
